The new pathogenic virus, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), was recently identified as the causative agent of the novel acute respiratory disease named coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) that started in the Hubei Province, China, and rapidly spread around the world.
1, 2 SARS-CoV-2 belongs to the Î²-CoV family and is enveloped by the spike glycoprotein trimmer (S) and the hemagglutinin-esterase (HE); it is characterized by a high infectivity: respiratory droplets and direct contacts represent the main form of transmission.
